projects.title: Vue Quotebuilder
projects.description: In this project I had to make a quote builder in Vue with CRUD functionality for products and invoices. The project also needed to run a daily cron to generate a summary of the invoices created that day. I ended up using Vue, Bootstrap and Laravel to build out the project to a minimal viable product.

projects.title: Remake the Netmatters Homepage
projects.description: The first project in the Netmatters SCS Scheme was to remake the netmatters Homepage. Throughout the course I was challenged to change the code to add different functionality, at first it was adding some javascript to add some functionality to the site and then later in the course I was challenged with adding a new page for a contact form that stored the results in a database.

projects.title: Javascript Image Assigner
projects.description: After learning javascript in the Netmatters SCS scheme I was challenged with making a basic image assigner with OO Javascript. The goal of the site was to fetch an image from an API which would then display to the screen and be possible to assign to a validated email address.

projects.title: Laravel Company Portal
projects.description:
After learning Laravel in the Netmatters SCS scheme I was challenged with making a company portal with full CRUD functionality for companies and employees. This is what I would determine my first full project with a working project at the end I had some trouble but overall really enjoyed laravel. All the styling was done with Bootstrap.

codeExamples.title: Vue Confirm Box
codeExamples.description: As part of my Vue quote builder I often needed a confirmation box so I made a reusable one with my pre-existing reusable modal which is based off the Bootstrap Modal.

codeExamples.title: Greyscale images
codeExamples.description: One of the main issues I had with remaking the Netmatters homepage was creating the hover effect of going from greyscale to colored on internet explorer. Because internet explorer doesn't support the needed filters that I was planning on using originally I had to use two seperate images and swap them in and out.

codeExamples.title: Javascript dynamic drop down.
codeExamples.description: With the javascript reflection I wanted to put the assigned images in containers and have them collapsable, I thought this would be a simple task but I also wanted it to have a smooth animation for opening and closing, this wasn't to simple as you can't animate auto heights in CSS. I ended up having to use javascript to measure the height being set by auto then setting the number so CSS could handle the animation.
